application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions:
TREE WORKS (COMPLIANCE):  All tree work shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard BS3998 - Recommendations for Tree Work.  In addition: 
a)   No fires shall be lit within [10] metres of the nearest point of the canopy of any retained tree.  No equipment, machinery or structure shall be attached to or supported by a retained tree.
b)   No mixing of cement or use of other contaminating materials or substances shall take place within, or close enough to, a root protection area that seepage or displacement could cause them to enter a root protection area. 
c)   No alterations or variations to the approved works or tree protection schemes shall be made without prior written consent of the local planning authority.

REASON:  In the interest of the protection of trees and to safeguard visual amenities.
description:
Tree locations - front and rear gardens

Front garden
Boundary with adjacent Council flats

T1 - 1x Elm 
Lift to 3.5m over street lamp and bench.

T2 - 1x Ailanthus
Lift to 3.5m over street lamp and bench.

T3 - 1x Silver Birch
Remove 1 small branch over gateway, this branch is being used as a perch for pigeons.

Rear Garden

T4 - 1x Mulberry (the subject of a TPO) - access via Aberdeen Lane
This tree recently lost a major part of its crown in a storm and the remaining part is now dying back.  The tree is loose in the ground.  There is good regrowth from the base of the tree but most of the upper crown is now dead.
We advise cutting back to leave a stump 1m in height to allow the new shoots to develop.  


T5 - 1x Semi mature Oak 
There is no room for this tree to develop to its full natural size and the branches extending over the council car park adjacent create a nuisance,.
The tree provides a very important screen against the recently constructed flats in Aberdeen Lane.  

We advise reduce crown overall by 2.5m leaving any internal growth as at present.

Gleditsia -Rear garden: Reduce by 1.5m overall.

Tree work is to be undertaken to remove dead branches to improve form and increase safety in accordance with good arboriculture practice and maintain the future wellbeing and growth of the trees.
